name: Julian Zubek
body:
I am a programmer and data scientist with an unusual predilection for unapplied social sciences.

Currently I work at the [Laboratory of Functional and Structural Genomics, CeNT UW](http://nucleus3d.cent.uw.edu.pl/). I also pursue PhD at the [Institute of Computer Science, PAS](http://www2.ipipan.waw.pl/index.php/en/).

### Projects

During my master studies I co-developed [Skarb](https://github.com/skarb/skarb) – an experimental Ruby to C compiler with some interesting optimizations of memory management.

Now I am active in research concerning cognitive systems, machine learning and its applications in bioinformatics. You can find the list of my publications on [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=a_9-qrcAAAAJ).

Some by-products of my scientific activity can be found as code repositories on my [Github account](https://github.com/zubekj/).

### Teaching

I had the pleasure to teach at [Summer School of Data Analysis 2015](http://www.delab.uw.edu.pl/szkola-letnia-dane-2015/) organized by DELab UW. Teaching materials are available [here](https://github.com/DELabUW/szkola-letnia-2015) (in Polish).

I teach a course “Introduction to modelling of cognitive processes” at University of Warsaw. You can find a short summary in a form of a comic [here](./cogsys_comic.pdf) (in Polish).
